results.title: Daughters of darkness = The Promise of red lips = The Red lips = Le Rouge aux levres
results.creator_credit: Harry Kumel, Paul Collet, Henry Lange, Maya Films and Showking Films
results.brief_description: In the lost space of an opulent Ostend hotel, eerily deserted in the off season, a young but hardly innocent couple on their honeymoon encounter the apparently ageless, sunlight-fearing, lesbian Countess Bathory. Kumel imaginatively balances the erotic malaise and violence of vampire folklore and a European (specifically Belgian) surrealist tradition with thirties Hollywood camp and comic strip tableaux. Perverse sexuality is located in a setting of decadent highlife which seems to immobilise the “victims”. Originally titled “La Rogue aux Levres” (Lips of Blood). Cast includes John Karlen, Delphine Seyrig, Danielle Ouimet and Andrea Rau.
results.title_for_label: Daughters of darkness = The Promise of red lips = The Red lips = Le Rouge aux levres

results.title: Dating the enemy
results.creator_credit: Megan Simpson, Sue Milliken and Total Films
results.brief_description: Guy Pearce and Claudia Karvan star in this comedy which looks at the battle between the sexes from a new perspective. Brett and Tash fall in love but when a lack of compromise threatens their relationship, the forces of the universe intervene. One day they awake to find themselves prisoners in each other’s bodies. Brett learns that being a woman, particularly Tash, presents its own challenges, while Tash learns more than she had bargained for about the male psyche.

results.title: Dating
results.creator_credit: Garry Dunstan, Pat Hunder and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Not suitable for adults”.
Examines dating and focuses on the “first date” for teenagers. Looks at dating from the point of view of girls and boys, and first date etiquette. Also examines how other cultures see their children in relation to dating.

results.title: Dates
results.creator_credit: Donovan Miller and Hollywood Film Enterprises
results.brief_description: Date growing in the Coachella Valley of Southern California. Outlines the history of date cultivation in the region; shows artificial pollination, harvesting, grading and packing of the fruit.

results.title: Date with history: Hiroshima
results.brief_description: Shows the preliminary events leading up to the bombing of Hiroshima in August, 1945 in which 72,000 people were killed. some of the people involved are interviewed, giving their reactions to the holocaust. The film contains actual footage of the events.

results.title: Date with Dizzy
results.creator_credit: John Hubley, Jim Di Gangi and Hubley Films
results.brief_description: A gentle satire on television commercials showing the production and use of effective advertising. Features Dizzy Gillespie and Quintet improvising a musical soundtrack for drawings made by John Hubley and his staff as they create animated-cartoon television commercials for a new product with unsuccessful results until the director screens three previous advertisements as examples of the desired effect. Concludes with a wild jam session led by Dizzy Gillespie. Several of the Hubley animation techniques are illustrated making this film useful for discussion on film technique.

results.title: Date of birth
results.creator_credit: Donald Fraser, Michael Spencer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A tribute to the older worker’s high standard of dependability and productivity, and a plea to employers to remove age barriers in hiring new staff. The bitter disappointment felt by an able man denied work because he is over forty-five is expressed in a brief dramatic sequence, and then the film presents the actual record of employees in this age group, reminding us that there is less absenteeism, a lower turnover rate and an equal standard of production among older workers. The importance to the whole country of giving a fair chance to workers over forty-five years of age is explained, and ways in which their problem is being tackled are described.

results.title: Data processing: an introduction
results.creator_credit: Dick Larson and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Introduces the basic data processing functions of sorting data, collating material and calculating, beginning with manual methods and moving into punched card equipment. With electronic computer systems, we learn ways of increasing the speed and flexibility of processing, resulting in faster ways of handling greater quantities of data.
